alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:55PM EST until December 19 at 4:20PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Philadelphia affecting Montgomery and Philadelphia Counties. For the Schuylkill River...including Philadelphia near 30th Street, Philadelphia...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.4 feet, Kelly Drive is flooded and closed between North Ferry Road and Falls Bridge. At 11.0 feet, Kelly Drive is flooded and closed between Hunting Park Avenue and Falls Bridge. The Flat Rock area is flooded. At 11.5 feet, Route 1 off ramp to Ridge Avenue is flooded and closed. MLK Drive is flooded and closed between Greenland Drive and Montgomery Drive. At 12.0 feet, Main Street in Manayunk floods in the area of Shurs Lane. At 13.0 feet, Main Street in Manayunk is closed from Ridge Avenue to Leverington Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 PM EST Monday was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 06/28/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Philadelphia 11.0 11.8 Mon 2 pm 10.6 8.9 12.5 7pm 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
